item.description:
Hello everyone,

Thanks again to Joanna at the Viral Technologies for hosting the last meeting.  This time, in addition to the standard meeting, greeting, sharing, and networking, Lee Patterson will lead us on a look into the cocos2D framework.   http://www.cocos2d-iphone.org/

cocos2d is a framework for building 2D games, demos, and other graphical/interactive applications.  Lee will demonstrate how to setup an application using cocos2d, how to create a menu with some elastic effects, and launch into a game. He will talk about some of the reasons you might use a framework like cocos2d instead of writing a sprite management engine yourself, as he did with his retro handheld style game Tog vs. Dino now in the app store.  They've recently added a cocos3d engine (complete with particle generators!) which looks to me to be the strongest reason yet to start using this framework.   

About Lee Patterson:   Lee is an Indie developer that writes video games and application software for iPhone, iPad, Mac and Windows. He has been a developer for over 17 years, and worked for companies like Electronic Arts, IBM and Mayo Clinic. He writes in C/C++, Java, Objective-C and even a little assembly for his robots. You can visit his web site at http://axorion.com.

The meeting will be over by 8:30 at the latest. 

Hoping to see you then and there,
Brian
item.name: Talk iOS development: Looking at cocos2d with Lee Patterson
